required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PLACE OF THE 18F-FDG-PET/CT IN THE DIAGNOSTIC WORKUP IN PATIENTS WITH CLASSICAL FEVER OF UNKNOWN ORIGIN (FUO)
clinical_study.official_title: PLACE OF THE 18F-FDG-PET/CT IN THE DIAGNOSTIC WORKUP IN PATIENTS WITH CLASSICAL FEVER OF UNKNOWN ORIGIN (FUO)

brief_summary.textblock:
Objective : To explore the diagnostic contribution of the 18F-FDG-PET/CT in a population of patients with classical fever of unknown origin (FUO), to precise its place in the diagnostic decision tree in a real-life setting and to identify factors associated with a diagnostic 18F-FDG-PET/CT.
Methods: All adult patients (age≥18 years) with a diagnosis of classical FUO who underwent a 18F-FDG-PET/CT in the University Hospital of Montpellier (France) between April 2012 and December 2017 were included. True positive 18F-FDG-PET/CT which evidenced a specific disease causing FUO were considered to be contributive.

primary_outcome.description: the diagnostic contribution of the 18F-FDG-PET/CT in a population of patients with classical FUO.

secondary_outcome.measure: 18F-FDG-PET/CT place in the diagnostic decision tree in a real-life setting
secondary_outcome.description: 18F-FDG-PET/CT place in the diagnostic decision tree in a real-life setting

study_pop.textblock: This retrospective study included all adult patients (age≥18 years) with a diagnosis of classical FUO who underwent a 18F-FDG-PET/CT in the University Hospital of Montpellier (France) between April 2012 and December 2017.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age≥18 years
- a diagnosis of classical FUO who underwent a 18F-FDG-PET/CT
Exclusion Criteria:
-refusal to participate-
